content.question: A model car travels around a circular track with radius 5 feet. Let <math alttext="Z" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> denote the distance between the model car and a fixed point that is 20 feet to the left of the center of the circular track. The diagram above indicates the fixed point at the origin, the center of the circular track at the point <math alttext="with coordinates 20 comma 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>20</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the position of the car at the point <math alttext="with coordinates x comma y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. <math alttext="Z" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the length of the line segment from the origin to the point <math alttext="with coordinates x comma y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. If <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are functions of time <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, in seconds, what is the rate of change of <math alttext="Z" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> when <math alttext="x equals 23" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>23</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="y equals 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="the derivative of x, with respect to t, equals 2 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ? (The equation of a circle with radius <math alttext="r" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and center <math alttext="with coordinates h comma k " overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mo>,</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> is <math alttext="open parenthesis, x minus h, close parenthesis, squared, plus, open parenthesis, y minus k, close parenthesis, squared, equals, r squared" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>h</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></math>.)

choices.label: <math alttext="the derivative of Z, with respect to t, equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>Z</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, so the distance between the model car and the fixed point is constant.

<math alttext="the derivative of Z, with respect to t, equals, the fraction with numerator 40, and denominator the square root of 545, end fraction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>Z</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>545</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, so the model car is moving away from the fixed point at a rate of approximately 1.7 feet per second.

<math alttext="the derivative of Z, with respect to t, equals, the fraction with numerator 40, and denominator the square root of 545, end fraction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>Z</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>545</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>, so the model car is moving toward the fixed point at a rate of approximately 1.7 feet per second.

<math alttext="the derivative of z, with respect to t, equals 80" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>Z</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>80</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, so the model car is moving away from the fixed point at a rate of 80 feet per second.

content.answer: <math alttext="the derivative of Z, with respect to t, equals, the fraction with numerator 40, and denominator the square root of 545, end fraction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>Z</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>545</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, so the model car is moving away from the fixed point at a rate of approximately 1.7 feet per second.
